intro: Commiphora assaortensis, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its aromatic resinous sap, which is used in traditional medicine and incense. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a leathery texture. Commiphora assaortensis thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in dry, well-drained soils.
